alert.note: Alert for Carteret; Dare; Hyde (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 27 at 2:44AM EDT until June 27 at 3:45AM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Newport has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Hyde County in eastern North Carolina... Southeastern Dare County in eastern North Carolina... Central Carteret County in eastern North Carolina... * Until 345 AM EDT. * At 244 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles southeast of Gull Rock to near Atlantic, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Cedar Island, Frisco, Harkers Island, Buxton, Salvo, Sealevel, Marshallberg, Waves, Davis, Smyrna, Avon, Atlantic, Rodanthe, Williston, Stacy, Portsmouth Village, Ocracoke Light House, Ocracoke Ferry Terminal, Cedar Island Ferry Terminal and Hatteras Ferry Terminal. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows. Please send your reports of hail and/or wind damage, including trees or large limbs downed, by calling the National Weather Service office in Newport at 1-800-889-6889.
